info.title: intelliHR
info.description: intelliHR is a cloud-based people management platform with advanced analytics capabilities.  Connect to your intelliHR tenant to automate people-oriented workflows (such as onboarding) and data export.

get.description: Get a single Job record by UUIDv4 identifier.

parameters.name: id
parameters.x-ms-summary: The ID of the job to return

parameters.name: asAt
parameters.x-ms-summary: Return data accurate for the job at this date
parameters.description:
Used to configure what date to return this job data for, as a [RFC3339](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6) datetime. 

All data returned from the job endpoints represent the values of the Person's job attributes at a specific point in time. 

By default, the current datetime is used, but this parameter can be used to configure a different datetime to see historical data.

identifier.description: Optional identifier that can be used for administrative tasks.

name.description: Name given to this [Business Unit](#tag/Business-Units). This name would normally be shown to users of the system.

parentId.description: The identifier string for the parent [Business Unit](#tag/Business-Units), or null if there is no parent (this is a top level business unit).

isEnabled.description: Specifies whether users can select this [Business Unit](#tag/Business-Units) in dropdowns.

endDate.description:
The date this [Job](#tags/jobs) ended or will end within the organisation. Required if not finalising an end date, or the job does not already have an end date. This date will follow the format defined by [RFC3339](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6).

 YYYY-MM-DD date formatting is also supported, although by using this format the date will be stored as the start of day in UTC time, not the requesting tenants timezone.

turnoverType.description: The type of turnover this end of job would be classified as: `voluntary`, `involuntary` or `unknown`. Required if finalising an end date.

turnoverReason.description: The name of the turnover reason. Required if `turnoverType` is not `unknown`.

companyStartDate.description:
The date this [Job](#tags/jobs) started or will start within the organisation. This date will follow the format defined by [RFC3339](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6).

 YYYY-MM-DD date formatting is also supported, although by using this format the date will be stored as the start of day in UTC time, not the requesting tenants timezone.

companyEndDate.description:
The date this [Job](#tags/jobs) ended or will end within the organisation. This date will follow the format defined by [RFC3339](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6).

 YYYY-MM-DD date formatting is also supported, although by using this format the date will be stored as the start of day in UTC time, not the requesting tenants timezone.

name.description: The job name to be created

fte.description: The full time equivalent of this [Job](#tag/Jobs). Indicating the workload of an employee that can be comparable across different contexts. This is null for people without an FTE.

effectiveFrom.description:
The date this [Job](#tags/jobs) Update is effective from within the organisation. Note that this doesn't affect the start date of the overall job itself. A `null` value will indicate that this Update is effective from the start of the [Job](#tags/jobs). This date will follow the format defined by [RFC3339](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6).

 YYYY-MM-DD date formatting is also supported, although by using this format the date will be stored as the start of day in UTC time, not the requesting tenants timezone.

effectiveTo.description:
The date this [Job](#tags/jobs) Update is effective to within the organisation. Note that this doesn't affect the end date of the overall job itself. This date will follow the format defined by [RFC3339](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6).

 YYYY-MM-DD date formatting is also supported, although by using this format the date will be stored as the start of day in UTC time, not the requesting tenants timezone.

name.description: The job name to be updated

fte.description: The full time equivalent of this [Job](#tag/Jobs). Indicating the workload of an employee that can be comparable across different contexts. This is null for people without an FTE.

preferredName.description: The [Person's](#tags/people) Preferred Name. Can generally be configured by employees for themselves.

gender.description: Human readable string for the [Person's](#tags/people) gender, e.g. `Male`. Searching is done case-insensitively and 'starts-with' e.g. passing `male` will match with a [Gender](#tags/genders) called "Male" as will "m" or "M". If multiple [Genders](#tags/genders) match the first will be chosen.

employeeNumber.description: A manually entered employee number that identifies a [Person](#tags/people) in intelliHR. It may be hidden in the system's UI depending upon your tenant's configuration.

title.description: The title to refer to this [Person](#tags/people) as, for example "Mr". This is null if not provided and is case insensitive.

customFields.description: The custom field values for this [Person](#tags/people)

workRightExpiryDate.description: The date this [Work Right](#tag/Work-Rights) will expire for this [Person](#tag/Person) (YYYY-MM-DD).

preferredName.description: The [Person's](#tags/people) Preferred Name. Can generally be configured by employees for themselves.

gender.description: Human readable string for the [Person's](#tags/people) gender, e.g. `Male`. Searching is done case-insensitively and 'starts-with' e.g. passing `male` will match with a [Gender](#tags/genders) called "Male" as will "m" or "M". If multiple [Genders](#tags/genders) match the first will be chosen.

employeeNumber.description: A manually entered employee number that identifies a [Person](#tags/people) in intelliHR. It may be hidden in the system's UI depending upon your tenant's configuration.

title.description: The title to refer to this [Person](#tags/people) as, for example "Mr". This is null if not provided and is case insensitive.

emailAddresses.description: Information about this [Person's](#tags/people) email addresses. This will replace all of their current emails. Note that a [Person](#tags/people) must have at least one primary email address.

phoneNumbers.description: Information about this [Person's](#tags/people) phone numbers. This will replace all of their current phone numbers. Note that a [Person](#tags/people) must have at least one primary phone number.

addresses.description: Information about this [Person's](#tags/people) addresses. This will replace all of their current addresses.

customFields.description: The custom field values for this [Person](#tags/people)

workRightExpiryDate.description: The date this [Work Right](#tag/Work-Rights) will expire for this [Person](#tag/Person) (YYYY-MM-DD).

Example filter: `filters[personId][eq]=8a5f3ea6-ea6b-4425-8a87-3c256bb7b6f9`

This filter supports the equality `[eq]` operation

personName.description:
The name for the [Person](#tags/People) to whom the [Job](#tags/Jobs) belongs.

Example filter: `filters[personName][eq]=Batman`

This filter supports the equality `[eq]` operation

primaryEmail.description:
The email address flagged as primary for the [Person](#tags/People)to whom the [Job](#tags/Jobs) belongs.

Example filter: `filters[primaryEmail][eq]=bruce.wayne@example.com`

This filter supports the equality `[eq]` operation

employeeNumber.description:
The employee number for the [Person](#tags/People) to whom the [Job](#tags/Jobs) belongs.

Example filter: `filters[employeeNumber][eq]=00001`

This filter supports the equality `[eq]` operation

autoIncrementIntellihrId.description:

Example filter: `filters[autoIncrementIntellihrId][eq]=1000`

This filter supports the equality `[eq]` operation

jobId.description:
The identifier string for the [Job](#tag/Jobs).

Example filter: `filters[jobId][eq]=1000`

This filter supports the equality `[eq]` operation

jobName.description:
The position title for the [Job](#tag/Jobs).

Example filter: `filters[jobName][eq]=Food%20Scientist`

This filter supports the equality `[eq]` operation

jobNameAsAt.description:
The date to filter jobName. This filter should be used in conjunction with jobName filter above. If not provided, it defaults to today.

Example filter: `filters[jobNameAsAt][eq]=2020-10-08T22%3A30%3A00%2B00%3A00`

This filter supports the equality `[eq]` operation

jobStatus.description:
The current status of this [Job](#tags/jobs) within this organisation. Enum: `Past Job`, `Future Job`, `Ending Job`, `Current Job`.

Example filter: `filters[jobStatus][eq]=Current%20Job`

This filter supports the equality `[eq]` operation

jobId.description:
The identifier string for the [Job](#tags/jobs).

Example filter: `filters[jobId][eq]=8a5f3ea6-ea6b-4425-8a87-3c256bb7b6f9`

This filter supports the equality `[eq]` operation

primaryEmailAddress.description:

employeeNumber.description:

Example filter: `filters[autoIncrementIntellihrId][eq]=1000`

This filter supports the equality `[eq]` operation

name.description:
Name of a [Person](#tags/people) in the system. This filter checks for an exact string match with any part of a [Persons](#tags/people) name. This filter is performed case insensitively and regardless of name order (e.g. `<last_name> <first_name>`). If multiple [People](#tags/people) match the `<filter_value>`, they will all be returned.

Example filter: `filters[name][eq]=Batman%20(Bruce)%20Wayne`

This filter supports the equality `[eq]` operation

RemunerationSchedule.title: RemunerationSchedule
RemunerationSchedule.description: The current remuneration details for this [Job](#tags/Jobs), including information such as salary and hourly pay, all [Jobs](#tags/Jobs) have a remuneration schedule but for unpaid employees they will have a special `No Remuneration Schedule` schedule.

type.description: The method in which this remuneration schedule is paid, if a person is unpaid then this will be `No Remuneration Schedule`. Enum: `Annual Salary`, `Hourly Rate`, `No Remuneration Schedule`.

baseAnnualSalary.description: The Base Salary paid yearly, this is an approximation if they are paid hourly. Note that if both baseAnnualSalary and baseHourlyRate are provided in a create or patch request, the baseHourlyRate will be ignored.

baseHourlyRate.description: The Base Rate paid hourly, this is an approximation if they are paid annually. Note that if both baseAnnualSalary and baseHourlyRate are provided in a create or patch request, the baseHourlyRate will be ignored.

currency.description: The currency that the base and total amounts that this job is being paid in. An international currency code. Typically AUD for Australian dollar, USD for American dollar etc. See [Official list of codes](https://www.iban.com/currency-codes).

hoursPerCycle.description: How many hours worked per payCycle.

payCycle.description: The cycle that the job is paid on. Enum: `Weekly`, `Fortnightly`, `Monthly`.

annualPackage.description: The total package paid yearly including additions and deductions. This amount is calculated by adding the Base Annual Salary and additions minus the deductions.

hourlyPackage.description: The total package paid hourly including additions and deductions. This amount is calculated by dividing the Annual Package by the total number of hours per annum.

currencyConversionOccurred.description: If any conversion had to be performed between addition and deduction currencies when calculating the annual package.

additions.description: An array of Additions for this Remuneration Schedule.

deductions.description: An array of Deductions for this Remuneration Schedule.

additionsToTotal.description: An array of Additions applied to the package after all other components for this Remuneration Schedule.

breakdowns.description: An array of Breakdowns for this Remuneration Schedule. Breakdowns will not be used to calculate the total package.

type.description: The method in which this remuneration schedule is paid. Enum: `Annual Salary`, `Hourly Rate`, `No Remuneration Schedule`.

currency.description: The currency that the base and total amounts that this job is being paid in. An international currency code. Typically AUD for Australian dollar, USD for American dollar etc. See [Official list of codes](https://www.iban.com/currency-codes).

hoursPerCycle.description: How many hours worked per payCycle.

baseAnnualSalary.description: The Base Salary paid yearly, this is only required if the Remuneration Schedule Type is "Annual Salary".

baseHourlyRate.description: The Base Rate paid hourly, this is only required if the Remuneration Schedule Type is "Hourly Rate".

additions.description: An array of Additions for the base salary.

additionsToTotal.description: an array of Additions for the total salary.

This [Work Class](#tag/Work-Classes) is specified as a search object, which will match the work class which best fits the keys for this object. Multiple keys can be used together to further narrow search results.

id.description: The identifier string for the [Work Class](#tag/Work-Classes) to whom this [Job](#tag/Jobs) belongs.

name.description: The name of the [Work Class](#tag/Work-Classes).

WorkRight.title: WorkRight
WorkRight.description: [Work Right](#tag/Work-Rights) to whom this [Person](#tag/Person) belongs. This [Work Right](#tag/Work-Rights) is specified as a search object, which will match the work right which best fits the keys for this object. Multiple keys can be used together to further narrow search results.

id.description: The identifier string for the [Work Right](#tag/Work-Rights) to whom this [Person](#tag/Person) belongs.

name.description: The name of the [Work Right](#tag/Work-Rights).

WorkRights.title: WorkRights
WorkRights.description: Show the working rights of the person

name.description: The type of the working rights

country.description: The country where the working rights are valid

expirationDate.description: The date the working rights are expiring

WorkType.title: WorkType
WorkType.description: [Work Type](#tag/Work-Types) to whom this [Job](#tag/Jobs) belongs. This [Work Type](#tag/Work-Types) is specified as a search object, which will match the work type which best fits the keys for this object. Multiple keys can be used together to further narrow search results.

id.description: The identifier string for the [Work Type](#tag/Work-Types) to whom this [Job](#tag/Jobs) belongs.

name.description: The name of the [Work Type](#tag/Work-Types). Enum: `Permanent`, `Fixed Contract`, `Unpaid`, `Temporary/Casual`, `Independent Contract`.

WorkType2.title: WorkType2
WorkType2.description: The parent [Work Type](#tag/Work-Types) of this [Work Class](#tag/Work-Classes).

id.description: The identifier string for the [Work Type](#tag/Work-Type) of this [Work Class](#tag/Work-Classes).

name.description: The name of the [Work Type](#tag/Work-Types). Enum: `Permanent`, `Fixed Contract`, `Unpaid`, `Temporary/Casual`, `Independent Contract`.

link.description: Link on the public api to get more information on this piece of data.

id.description: The identifier string for the [Work Type](#tag/Work-Type).

name.description: The name of the [Work Type](#tag/Work-Types). Enum: `Permanent`, `Fixed Contract`, `Unpaid`, `Temporary/Casual`, `Independent Contract`.

isEnabled.description: Specifies whether users can select this [Work Type](#tag/Work-Types) in dropdowns.

tags.name: Business Entities
tags.description: [Business Entities](#tag/Business-Entities) represent the legal entities which exist within the organisation. A [Business Entity](#tag/Business-Entities) can be used as a filter for automation logic (eg Pulse configuration) and as a dimension in the analytics tools. Every [Job](#tag/Jobs) in the system belongs to a [Business Entity](#tag/Business-Entities).

tags.name: Business Units
tags.description: The administrative units that exist within the organisation. Used to render the org chart business unit view. For example, "Finance", "HR", or "Information Technology". [Business Units](#tag/Business-Units) can be configured as text strings with parent -> child relationships. Every [Job](#tag/Jobs) in the system belongs to a [Business Unit](#tag/Business-Units).

tags.name: Custom Field Definitions
tags.description: Custom Field Definitions can be used to attach extra data fields to particular models in the system such as [Training](#tag/Trainings).

tags.name: Default Remuneration Components
tags.description: [Default Remuneration Components](#tag/Default-Remuneration-Components) are the organization-wide remuneration components for both additions and breakdowns.

tags.name: Employment Conditions
tags.description: Employment conditions are the conditions under which someone is paid for their remuneration schedule. Every [Job](#tag/Jobs) in the system belongs to a [Employment Condition](#tag/Employment-Conditions) or the `No Employment Condition` Employment Condition.

tags.name: End Job
tags.description: Set and finalise the end date of a job. Finalising a job changes it to a past job on the end date.

tags.name: Jobs
tags.description:
The Job object is the core data object for past, current and future roles that a Person holds in the organisation. A Person can have more than one Job at a point in time to represent secondment / role sharing.
The data returned from this endpoint represents the data at this current time, which may change over time due to scheduled changes. This endpoint returns the [Job's](#tag/Jobs) Remuneration Schedule.

tags.name: Locations
tags.description: Locations can be configured as text strings with parent -> child relationships. For example, `Australia` -> `Brisbane` -> `Spring Hill Head Office`. These locations are used for filtering in analytics. Every [Job](#tag/Jobs) in the system belongs to a [Location](#tag/Locations) or the `No Location` Location.

tags.name: Pay Grades
tags.description: Pay Grades are optional attributes applied to a job to provide a salary range for analytical purposes. These are configurable for admins in the intelliHR application. Every [Job](#tag/Jobs) in the system belongs to a [Pay Grade](#tag/Pay-Grades) or the `No Pay Grade` Pay Grade.

tags.name: People
tags.description: People represent the base objects in the intelliHR data model. All past, present and future employees should be created as a Person and then have a Job created which references that Person object. Contact information for the employee (eg emergency contact, phone numbers, email addresses, etc) is referenced to the Person object. While Jobs can have scheduled updates which will take effect in the future, People are always static in the system and will not change unless updated.

tags.name: Person Documents
tags.description:
[Person Document](#tag/Person-Documents) is an object which represents the document stored in the "Documents" tab in Person Profile in intelliHR system. You can upload a document through this API by following the steps below.

1. Create a presigned upload URL which enables you to upload a document to S3 by using [Create a presigned upload URL](#tag/Person-Documents/paths/~1person-documents/post) endpoint.
2. Upload a document to the S3 presigned URL with HTTP PUT method.
3. Mark the upload status successful with [Update a Document](#tag/Person-Documents/paths/~1person-documents~1{id}/patch) endpoint.

These steps can be automatically handled by [Zapier](https://zapier.com/apps/intellihr/integrations) "Upload Person Document" action.

tags.name: Recruitment Sources
tags.description: Recruitment sources refer to the origin of this employee, such as a job board or a recruitment agency. These are configured as text strings in the intelliHR application and are used as filters for analytical purposes. [Recruitment Sources](#tag/Recruitment-Sources) can be configured as text strings with parent -> child relationships.

tags.name: Training Providers
tags.description: [Training Providers](#tag/Training-Providers) are used in the system to document what/who provided the [Training](#tag/trainings).

tags.name: Trainings
tags.description: [Trainings](#tag/Trainings) are used in the system to store details about individual training events.

tags.name: Training Types
tags.description: [Training Types](#tag/Training-Types) are used in the system to document the category of a [Training](#tag/Trainings) record.

tags.name: Work Classes
tags.description: Work Classes are a sub-class of Work Types. For example, the `Permanent` Work Type has both `Full-Time` and `Part-Time` Work Classes. These are used for to configure automation and analytics filters. Every [Job](#tag/Jobs) in the system belongs to a [Work Class](#tag/Work-Classes).

tags.name: Work Rights
tags.description: [Work Rights](#tag/Work-Rights) are the organization-wide work rights.

tags.name: Work Types
tags.description: Work Types represent the primary work classification for a job. It is one of the types `Permanent`, `Fixed Contract`, `Unpaid` or `Temporary/Casual`. This attribute is always used with the Work Class attribute which is a sub class of Work Type. Every [Job](#tag/Jobs) in the system belongs to a [Work Type](#tag/Work-Types).

tags.name: Webhook Events
tags.description:
[Webhook Events](#tag/Webhook-Events) are hardcoded events which occur within the intelliHR platform which can be subscribed to using [Webhooks](#tag/Webhooks).

  As an example, person.created is a [Webhook Event](#tag/Webhook-Events), which can trigger a [Webhook](#tag/Webhooks) when a [Person](#tag/People) is created within the platform.

tags.name: Webhooks
